author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Tim Kaine (D-Va.) introduced a resolution Monday seeking to prevent the U.S. from getting involved in a military conflict with Iran without congressional approval. The resolution reaffirms existing law, directing the president to end any use of the U.S. armed forces “for hostilities” against Iran “unless explicitly authorized by a declaration of war or…
title: Democrat moves to prevent Trump from striking Iran without congressional approval

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson (R) says he cannot support the Senate bill to enact President Trump’s agenda to cut taxes, secure the border and boost defense spending because it doesn’t do enough to reduce the federal deficit, telling reporters he’s a “no” on the legislation. Johnson said the bill needs a lot more work after…
title: GOP senator says he will oppose Senate tax, Medicaid bill

author: Tobias Burns
description: Senate Republicans’ tax and spending cut bill makes many of the core elements of their 2017 tax cuts permanent but scales back additional cuts from what the House passed. The Senate Finance Committee unveiled its version of the central piece of President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” on Monday. The Senate bill locks in existing federal…
title: Senate scales back additional Trump tax cuts in its version of ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump and United Kingdom Prime Minister Keir Starmer detailed the trade deal between the United States and the U.K. a month after the two trading partners announced the agreement. While at the Group of Seven (G7) summit in Canada, Trump said the agreement is “a great deal for both, going to produce a lot…
title: Trump, Starmer detail US-UK trade pact

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Senate’s version of the “big, beautiful bill” includes changes to green energy tax credits that are more flexible than those passed by the House — but would still be a significant rollback. This flexibility is likely to please moderates in both chambers who felt that the House version was too stringent. However, it could…
title: Senate takes more flexible approach to GOP’s green tax credit rollback

author: Joseph Choi
description: A federal judge on Monday ruled that the Trump administration’s canceling of federal health grants over their connections to “gender ideology” and “diversity, equity, and inclusion” was unlawful and void. U.S. District Court Judge William Young, a Reagan appointee, ruled on Monday that targeting research funded by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) based on…
title: Judge orders many NIH grants restored, calling cancellation unlawful

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The American Bar Association (ABA) has filed a lawsuit challenging the administration’s crackdown on the legal profession, casting President Trump’s various executive orders as a “Law Firm Intimidation Policy.” The First Amendment suit, nearly 100 pages long, argues that Trump’s targeting of firms has created a chilling effect among all firms, regardless of whether they’ve signed…
title: ABA sues Trump over series of orders targeting law firms

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday took a swipe at former Fox News host Tucker Carlson, who has in recent days been critical of Trump’s handling of the burgeoning conflict between Israel and Iran. “I don’t know what Tucker Carlson is saying. Let him go get a television network and say it so that people listen,” Trump…
title: Trump swipes at Tucker Carlson over Israel-Iran criticism

author: Joseph Choi
description: The Trump administration on Monday denied reporting by The Guardian that said new Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) hospitals could refuse care to veterans based on factors like marital status and political affiliation due to an executive order by President Trump. The Guardian earlier Monday published a report saying VA hospitals are implementing new rules…
title: White House denies reporting by Guardian on VA benefits: ‘Totally FALSE story’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Democratic Senators have urged Secretary of State Marco Rubio to save the State Department's human rights arm, citing its importance in advancing U.S. national security priorities and championing the cause of those living in societies dominated by fear and oppression.
title: Democrats call on Rubio to preserve State Department human rights bureau

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: A press freedom group is suing the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) and the city itself over what the organization says is mistreatment of journalists covering the civil unrest there in response to President Trump’s immigration initiatives. As part of a lawsuit filed Monday, the Los Angeles Press Club argued police officers trying to contain…
title: Press group sues LAPD, city over actions during anti-ICE protests

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Rep. Greg Landsman (D-Ohio) said Monday that his name was one of at least 45 listed in evidence linked to the man accused of shooting two Minnesota Democratic lawmakers over the weekend. Landsman said he was informed by Capitol Police on Sunday morning, at which point the suspect, Vance Boelter, was still at large. Landsman…
title: House Democrat says his name was included in Minnesota shooting suspect’s notes

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Abortion providers and reproductive rights advocates are devastated by the assassination of a Minnesota state lawmaker and her husband over the weekend by a suspect who allegedly planned to also target abortion providers.  Former state Speaker Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband were shot and killed in their home just outside of Minneapolis on Saturday.…
title: Abortion providers devastated by political killings, hit list

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Finance Committee Chair Mike Crapo (R-Idaho) on Monday released the Senate’s long-awaited version of President Trump’s tax agenda, which would make the 2017 corporate tax cuts permanent, cut hundreds of billions of dollars in Medicaid spending and phase out renewable-energy tax cuts enacted under President Biden. The legislative text crafted by Senate Finance Committee…
title: Senate releases Trump tax and Medicaid blueprint

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: The use of artificial intelligence (AI) in the workplace has nearly doubled over the past two years, according to a new survey. A Gallup study, released Monday, found the share of U.S. employees who say they have used AI in their role a few times a year nearly doubled from 21 percent to 40 percent…
title: AI adoption in workplace nearly doubles: Gallup

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Hillary Scholten (D-Mich.) has postponed her town hall event on Monday following the weekend shootings of Democratic lawmakers in Minnesota. “West Michigan, I want nothing more than to hear from you in person during town halls and other events,” Scholten wrote in a post on the social platform X. “However, after the events of…
title: Michigan lawmaker postpones town hall after Minnesota shootings

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: An Israeli airstrike hit the headquarters of Iranian state television in Tehran on Monday in the middle of a live broadcast, filling the studio with dust and debris as the anchor hurried out of the frame. The feed was then cut off but resumed after a few minutes. Hassan Abedini, the deputy director of Iran’s…
title: Israel strikes Iranian state TV studio during live broadcast

author: Alexander Bolton
description: The Senate’s version of a bill to enact President Trump’s agenda goes further to reduce Medicaid spending than the House-passed bill does, according to GOP aides familiar with the legislation. GOP aides say it will go further to tighten Medicaid eligibility requirements and to restrict states from using health care provider taxes to draw down more federal…
title: Senate version of Trump agenda bill cuts more from Medicaid: GOP aides

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu expressed support for killing Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei to end their ongoing military conflict, despite President Trump reportedly rejecting a plan to do so.
title: Netanyahu doesn’t rule out targeting Iran’s supreme leader

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Congressional Hispanic Caucus (CHC) is calling on Republican leadership to “uphold the dignity and authority of Congress” after Sen. Alex Padilla (D-Calif.) was handcuffed after interjecting at a press conference held by Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem on Friday. Padilla was blocked by security as he advanced toward the front of the room, identifying himself…
title: CHC asks Johnson, Thune to ‘uphold the dignity’ of Congress after Padilla handcuffing

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: A federal judge in Boston ruled on Monday to extend the pause on the Trump administration’s order to take away Harvard University’s ability to enroll international students.  Judge Allison Burroughs’s ruling, which extends her pause until June 23, builds on a decision made at the end of May after Harvard requested an emergency hearing when…
title: Judge extends ruling against Trump visa block for Harvard

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Environmental activists are demanding that Colorado Parks and Wildlife prohibit the commercial sale of wildlife furs, filing a citizen rulemaking petition urging swift action on Monday. Contrary to the vast protections granted by Colorado to other animals, the Centennial State currently allows the for-profit sale of furs from all species deemed “furbearers,” according to the…
title: Activists urge Colorado to ban commercial sale of furs taken from state wildlife

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser said Monday that cleanup from the weekend’s military parade will take several more days but that there is no damage to report so far to the city roads or infrastructure. “We expect for them to clean up over several days,” Bowser said at a press conference when asked about the…
title: DC mayor: Military parade cleanup expected to take several more days

author: Ross Baird, opinion contributor
description: Opportunity Zones have helped create new housing in low-income areas at a lower cost to taxpayers, and Congress should continue to improve and expand the program to address America's housing crisis.
title: Opportunity Zones have quietly become America’s most effective housing program

author: Jorge Vela
description: One farmer in rural Texas says none of his employees have wanted to come to work out of fear of being picked up during an ICE raid, "whether they are legal or illegal."
title: ‘100 percent’ haven’t shown up to work due to immigration raids, Texas farmer says

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The Washington Post was hit with a cyberattack targeting some its journalists in recent days, a source familiar with the situation confirmed to The Hill on Monday. The attack, first reported by The Wall Street Journal over the weekend, impacted a small amount of reporters at the news outlet and has since been contained, the…
title: Washington Post hit with cyberattack

author: Chelsea Follett, opinion contributor
description: Recent research suggests that prosperity does not inevitably lead to fewer children, and that rising female earnings are associated with higher fertility rates in many high-income nations.
title: No, prosperity doesn’t cause population collapse

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: The man accused of shooting two Democratic lawmakers and their spouses over the weekend will be charged with a slate of federal crimes, including stalking, murder and shooting, prosecutors announced at a news conference Monday. Vance Boelter was taken into custody Sunday night following the largest manhunt in Minnesota’s history. Authorities tracked him down in…
title: What we know about Vance Boelter, the suspect in the Minnesota lawmaker shootings

author: Tara Suter
description: The State Department is warning against travel to Israel, the West Bank and Gaza amid the conflict between Iran and Israel. In a travel advisory on its website, the department warned travelers not to go to Israel “due to armed conflict, terrorism, and civil unrest,” to avoid the West Bank “due to terrorism and civil…
title: State Department warns against travel to Israel, West Bank and Gaza

author: Julia Manchester
description: Former Rep. Colin Allred (D-Texas) said he would “run differently” if he launches a second Senate campaign, including being in Texas full time.  “I’m proud that in the last campaign we had the most ticket splitters of any state in the country,” Allred told NBC 5 Dallas on Sunday. “We outperformed by votes, the presidential…
title: Allred says he’d ‘run differently’ if he launches new Texas Senate campaign

author: Ryan Hampton, opinion contributor
description: President Trump has the opportunity to strengthen mental health parity by leveraging his transparency agenda and ensuring that health insurance plans for mental health and substance use disorders are no more restrictive than for medical or surgical care.
title: President Trump should embrace stronger, smarter mental health parity

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Former longtime ABC News reporter Terry Moran defended his social media post blasting President Trump as a “hater,” a post that eventually led to the reporter’s ouster from the network. “It’s way hot. And I wish I had a better story. It was something that was in my heart and mind. And I would say…
title: Terry Moran defends Trump ‘hater’ post that sparked ABC ouster: ‘Spitting venom and lies’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Eric Trump credited his father, President Trump, with uniting the Republican Party and making politics fun again, on the 10th anniversary of his first campaign launch.
title: Eric Trump on father’s legacy: He’s ‘killed every RINO’ in Washington

author: Rachel Frazin
description: A Democratic member of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) says he was illegally fired by President Trump. In a Monday post on LinkedIn, Christopher Hanson said that President Trump had fired him from the independent commission that regulates nuclear power safety. “Late on Friday, President Trump terminated my position with the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission…
title: Trump fires Democratic member of nuclear energy safety commission

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Federal prosecutors unveiled murder and stalking charges Monday against the man suspected of shooting two Minnesota state lawmakers and their spouses.  Vance Boelter, 57, was arrested on state murder charges Sunday night after a two-day manhunt. Minnesota does not have the death penalty, but federal prosecutors could try to execute him if Boelter is convicted on…
title: Minnesota suspect hit with federal murder, stalking charges

author: Tom Schatz, opinion contributor
description: Daniel Steiner, the new postmaster general, should prioritize the delivery of mail and packages six days a week, halt the Delivering for America plan, and terminate the Regional Transportation Optimization initiative to revitalize the Postal Service's fiscal outlook and continue to connect communities with affordable and efficient delivery.
title: A blueprint for the new postmaster general

author: Harlan Ullman, opinion contributor
description: Rarely have so many potential dangers been present at the same time
title: Potential unrest at home and abroad puts the US in an uneasy position

author: Emily Rahhal
description: New York State Court officers were stabbed and slashed inside a lower Manhattan court Monday morning, officials said.
title: Multiple officers stabbed at New York City criminal court: Officials

author: David W. Wise, opinion contributor
description: Since taking office, Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has become a leading advocate for greater provincial autonomy.
title: A secession movement brews in western Canada

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Israeli officials have urged hundreds of thousands of people in Tehran to evacuate in preparation for new strikes against Iran, with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declaring that Israel now controls the skies over Tehran.
title: Tehran residents warned to evacuate ahead of Israeli strikes

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday began the Group of Seven (G-7) summit in Canada by arguing it was a mistake to kick Russia out of the organization more a decade ago. “The G-7 used to be the G-8. Barack Obama and a person named [former Prime Minister Justin] Trudeau didn’t want to have Russia in, and…
title: Trump criticizes Russia being booted from G7

author: Ella Lee
description: The Supreme Court on Monday declined to revive a copyright challenge to Ed Sheeran’s “Thinking Out Loud” that accused the pop star of unlawfully emulating the late Marvin Gaye’s “Let’s Get It On.” The justices turned away an appeal by Structured Asset Sales, a partial owner to the rights of Gaye’s 1973 hit, which filed…
title: Supreme Court won’t revive copyright suit over Ed Sheeran’s ‘Thinking Out Loud’

author: Tara Suter
description: A U.S embassy branch in Tel Aviv was slightly damaged due to shock wavers from Iranian missiles that hit the city, according to U.S. Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee. Huckabee said no personnel were hurt and that the property damage was minor. “Our @usembassyjlm US Embassy in Israel & Consulate will officially remain closed today…
title: US embassy branch in Tel Aviv slightly damaged due to Iranian missiles

author: Emily Smith
description: A Detroit mother got an earful from a judge after she was seen preparing a peanut butter and jelly sandwich during a virtual court hearing.
title: Michigan woman makes PB&J during virtual court session, and judge is not happy

description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) on Monday condemned social media posts from her colleague Sen. Mike Lee (R-Utah) spreading unfounded claims about the man suspected of killing a Minnesota Democratic lawmaker and her husband on Saturday morning. “I have condemned what Mike Lee did here at home, and I will speak to him about this when…
title: Klobuchar condemns Mike Lee’s posts about Minnesota suspect: ‘This isn’t funny’

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The attorneys general of all 50 states, Washington D.C. and four territories have agreed to sign on to a $7.4 billion settlement with Purdue Pharma and the members of the Sackler family who own the company.  The settlement seeks to resolve thousands of lawsuits over the opioid crisis. The family members would acknowledge their role…
title: All states, territories agree to $7.4B Purdue Pharma opioid settlement

author: John Kenneth White, opinion contributor
description: Musk represents not merely a threat to Trump but to the long-term interests of the Republican Party.
title: The Trump-Musk feud shows Republicans are in a prison of their own making

author: Michael Scheidt
description: Reverend Jimmy Swaggart was transported to the hospital in critical condition after suffering cardiac arrest on Father's Day.
title: Rev. Jimmy Swaggart taken to hospital in critical condition

author: Angela Huffman, opinion contributor
description: The MAHA Commission’s assessment report marks a historic recognition of a crisis decades in the making: The American diet, shaped by a highly consolidated food system dominated by a handful of corporations, is fueling a chronic-disease crisis
title: Making America healthy begins with farmers

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Political pundit Chuck Todd ripped President Trump on Sunday over his decision to direct U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to expand deportation efforts in cities run by Democrats. The president in a Truth Social post Sunday urged ICE agents “to do all in their power” to help reach the administration’s mass deportation goals in…
title: Chuck Todd: Trump ‘openly admitting that he’s politicizing law enforcement’

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump expressed his opposition to Israeli plans to kill Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, The Associated Press reported Sunday night, citing a U.S. official familiar with the matter. The AP reported Israeli officials informed the Trump administration that a credible plan was coming together to kill Khamenei, and the White House, in response,…
title: Trump rejected Israeli plan to kill Iran’s supreme leader: Report

author: William Becker, Opinion Contributor
description: Oil companies are fighting lawsuits to recover the costs of climate-intensified weather disasters, while President Trump is helping them by repealing environmental regulations and canceling clean energy projects.
title: Who will pay for climate change? You will, until we break the fossil-fuel addiction.

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to review New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin’s (D) subpoena seeking donor records from a network of anti-abortion clinics.  In a brief order, the justices said they will examine whether First Choice Women’s Resource Centers can mount a First Amendment challenge in federal court.  Lower judges ruled the group’s…
title: Supreme Court to review New Jersey AG’s subpoena to anti-abortion clinics

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: A new Gallup poll shows only 38 percent of Republicans now agree that “gay or lesbian relations” are morally acceptable.
title: Have gay rights stalled with Trump back in power?

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: A slight majority of Americans questioned — 51 percent — view Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. favorably, according to an NBC News poll released on Monday.  Slightly fewer than half of respondents — 48 percent — view him unfavorably, including a majority of Democrats surveyed. When questioned about Kennedy’s “Make America…
title: Slight majority views RFK Jr. favorably: Poll

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene is urging Trump supporters to seek peace, not war, and to oppose U.S. involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict, arguing that it would harm Americans more than it is worth.
title: Greene hits those ‘slobbering’ for US involvement in Israel-Iran conflict

author: Tara Suter
description: Israel is claiming “aerial superiority” over Iran’s capital of Tehran on the fourth day of fighting, which saw new waves of strikes between the Middle East rivals. At least five people were killed in Iranian missile attacks Monday in Israel, according to The Associated Press, as Israel declared it controls the skies over Tehran and…
title: Israel claims ‘aerial superiority’ over Iran capital

author: Ian Swanson
description: The Trump Organization on Monday announced it was launching a new mobile phone business: Trump Mobile. It’s the latest new business the Trump Organization is getting into during President Trump’s second term in the White House, a dynamic that has raised various ethical concerns from his critics. Donald Trump Jr., the president’s oldest son, announced…
title: Trump Organization announces new ‘Trump Mobile’ phone service

author: Douglas Schoen, opinion contributor
description: Americans increasingly disapprove of Trump’s response, even if they also do not support the civil unrest.
title: Polls show support for Trump’s deportations is declining

author: Tara Suter
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) called for “decency” and denounced “mean tweets” late Sunday while announcing the arrest of a suspect in shootings that killed former Minnesota Democratic House Speaker Melissa Hortman and injured Minnesota state Sen. John Hoffman (D). Walz said during a press conference that lawmakers in the state worked toward compromise “year…
title: Walz calls for ‘decency’ after Minnesota shootings: ‘It’s not about mean tweets’

author: Austin Sarat, Opinion Contributor
description: “Always say yes to the president.”
title: Why are we still talking about Biden’s presidency?

author: Becket Adams, Opinion Contributor
description: There is plenty of photo and video evidence showcasing the violent unrest in Los Angeles — everything from cars set ablaze to rioters hurling chunks of concrete at law enforcement officers and their vehicles.
title: LA riot coverage shows the media’s Biden ‘miss’ wasn’t a miss at all — they just lie

author: Clara Duhon
description: Former President Obama said Dreamers are “being demonized and treated as enemies” in a social media post marking the 13th anniversary of his administration establishing the creation of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program. “DACA was an example of how we can be a nation of immigrants and a nation of laws,” Obama…
title: Obama on DACA anniversary: Dreamers ‘being demonized and treated as enemies’

author: Jesse Byrnes
description: The man suspected of shooting two Minnesota state lawmakers over the weekend, killing one of the lawmakers, has been taken into custody after a massive manhunt. Vance Boelter was arrested on Sunday evening, The Associated Press reported. He was taken into custody near his home, according to multiple reports. “The face of evil. After relentless and…
title: Suspect in Minnesota lawmaker shootings in custody: reports

author: Julia Manchester
description: American Federation of Teachers (AFT) President Randi Weingarten is departing the Democratic National Committee, citing disagreements with DNC Chair Ken Martin. Weingarten told Martin in a letter dated June 5 and obtained by The Hill on Sunday that she was declining to be reappointed as an at-large member of the committee. “While I am a…
title: Teachers union head Randi Weingarten resigns from DNC
